resources.string: This here is a sample app to show off my Rhythm library and inspire you to use it. It’s a small library that allows you to define custom overlays (grids, keylines, and more) and draw them over your views, therefore helping you to build pixel-perfect Material Design layouts.
After playing around with the sample check out its source code for complete experience.
Hey! Since you’re already judging, please report if you notice something out of rhythm (i.e. not aligned to 8dp/4dp grid) in this sample, will you?
Take a moment to appreciate this beautifully laid out card.

Pull down the notification shade to find Rhythm Quick Control. You can switch overlays for registered groups at runtime. Try this now, change overlay for every group, and see if you can find layout bounds.
Rhythm 0.9.5 introduces declarative config, making building overlays a breeze. Examine the /res/raw/overlay_config, or try it out right here!
